subject: Internal Guidelines for calculation of Termination Payments of Road Projects on BOT (Toll) Mode.
text: HRdy <74fy <THT gfaarUT T19 Phone : 91-11-25074100/25074200 (T8; qRde7 & TntAf #iy) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 0-5 & 6, 8q2<-10, ERVT; 7f frrft 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/ Financial Matters/2021 Policy Guidelines No. 8.4.24/2021 Dated 03rd February, 2021 (Decision taken on e-file Comp. No. 46370) Sub:- Internal Guidelines for calculation of Termination Payments of Road Projects on BOT (Toll) Mode_ 1 Objective: This is an internal document for guidance of officers of NHAI to calculate the Termination Payment, which should be in consonance with the respective Project Concession Agreements. 2. Applicability: These guidelines are applicable to all BOT (Toll) projects which are terminated for  default attributable to either party. The procedure  provided in these guidelines is based on the Model Concession Agreement; however, the relevant clauses of the signed Concession Agreement of the project shall prevail  3. Relevant_Clauses_and Definitions_in the Model Concession Agreement (MCA= for Reference: The definitions referred to in these guidelines have been adopted from Model Concession Agreement (MCA) for BOT (Toll) Model and are appended at Annexure A 4. Process for_calculation of Termination Payment 4.1 NHAI Technical Division shall: (i) Establish and record the cause of default /Force Majeure, and party to which the default is attributable: Accordingly, the Termination Payment shall be classified into either  Concessionaire Default, `Authority Default, Political Force Majeure, Non- Political Force Majeure, or Indirect Political Force Majeure Events; (ii) Establish and record the Transfer which shall be used for calculation of Termination Payment; and (iii)   Confirm whether the Concessionaire has notified the Total Project Cost as on COD and its disaggregation between Debt Due and Equity, within 60 days from COD. Accordingly, the Technical Division shall calculate tha Termination Payment with all supporting documents and send it to Finance Division for its comments. 4.2 Calculation of Total Project Cost (TPC): TPC shall be calculated as per the definition provided in the Concession Agreement, subject tothat, if the project is not completed in entirety, the Total Project Cost shall be reduced suitably for the incomplete work as certified by the Independent Engineer. 4.3 Calculation of Debt Due and Equity: (i) Debt Due' shall be calculated as per the disaggregation notice received: If the disaggregation  notice has not been  received, the equity shall be arrived at by deducting the Debt Due from the Total Project Cost. (ii) If the disaggregation notice has been received, the Cebt to Equity ratio indicated in the disaggregation notice shall be adopted while calculating the Debt and Equity. iik9 Contd.
